sources.title: Jazz Heaven (1929) JOHN MACK BROWNüçï SALLY O'NEILüçï MUSIC ROMANCE
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: John Mack Brown, Sally O'Neil, Clyde Cook
Director: Melville Brown
From the dawn of the talkie era comes a delightful blend of romance, ambition, and music, brought to life by RKO Productions and Radio Pictures. Directed by Melville Brown, this charming comedy follows a struggling songwriter and a hopeful singer as they chase success‚Äîand each other‚Äîthrough the bustling world of Tin Pan Alley.

Sally O‚ÄôNeil brings warmth and spark to the role of Marge, a spirited young woman with dreams as big as the city skyline. John Mack Brown plays Barry Holmes, a down-on-his-luck composer whose tune might just hit the right note with the help of Marge‚Äôs clever improvisation and unwavering faith.

Backed by a cast including Clyde Cook and Joseph Cawthorn, this early musical romance showcases the transitional era of silent-to-sound filmmaking, complete with synchronized songs and urban jazz-age flair.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

A breezy, upbeat portrait of creative hustle and young love, this film reflects the energy and optimism of late 1920s Hollywood, as well as RKO‚Äôs early foray into sound cinema. Experience a hidden gem from the early talkie revolution in a beautifully restored presentation.

#SallyONeil #JohnnyMackBrown #MelvilleBrown #OscarLevant #RKO #EarlyTalkies #JazzAgeCinema #PreCodeFilm #ClassicRomance #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: Barry Holmes (Johnny Mack Brown), a southern songwriter, come to New York City's Tin-Pan Alley and meets and falls in love with radio-singer Ruth Morgan (Sally O'Neill) and they team up to write a song that will make them rich and famous. And with the help of song publishers Hennan Kemple (Joseph Cawthorn) and Walter Klucke (Albert Conti), they succeed.
metadata.Writer: Pauline Forney, Dudley Murphy, J. Walter Ruben
metadata.Actors: Sally O'Neil, Johnny Mack Brown, Clyde Cook
